meanings.sent1: The eagle will swoop down to catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: I saw a bird swoop from the sky to the ground.
meanings.sent3: The superhero decided to swoop in and save the day.
meanings.sent4: The price of the stock market can swoop down unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves swoop around in circles.

meanings.definition: A sudden, swift movement or action
meanings.sent1: With a swoop, the cat pounced on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent2: The magician's cape had a dramatic swoop as he performed his trick.
meanings.sent3: The swoop of the dancer's skirt added flair to her performance.
meanings.sent4: The swoop of the roller coaster was exhilarating.
meanings.sent5: The swoop of the hawk's wings was mesmerizing to watch.
